text: Network execs hoping the new fall season would shake up the gloomy narrative surrounding the broadcast TV industry aren ’ t finding many reasons for optimism in the early Nielsen numbers. Year - to - year declines, particularly among younger viewers, have been positively brutal : NBC, CBS, and Fox all saw their premiere week Nielsen averages among adults under 50 decline between 16 and 24 percent. ABC claimed a victory of sorts by remaining flat compared to 2016, but that ’ s only because last year ’ s premiere week numbers were particularly awful. Network suits will note that these early numbers matter far less than they used to, and that ’ s true — to a point.
